intro: Krugiodendron acuminatum, commonly known as the yellowwood tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a dense canopy. Its bark is smooth and grayish, often peeling in thin layers. The plant is valued for its hard, durable wood and is also used in traditional medicine.
